title: Chicken Parmigiana
description: Crispy breaded chicken cutlets baked with a bright tomato-basil sauce and melted Parmesan-Mozzarella. Finished under the broiler for a golden bubbly top, this classic Italian-American dish is comforting, savory, and adaptable for weeknight dinners.

ingredients.display_name: boneless skinless chicken breasts (about 6-8 oz each), butterflied or pounded to 1/2-inch
ingredients.notes: butterfly or pound to even 1/2-inch thickness
beaten with a pinch of salt

ingredients.display_name: plain dry breadcrumbs (or panko for extra crisp)

ingredients.notes: mix half into breadcrumbs and reserve some for topping

ingredients.display_name: prepared tomato sauce (marinara) or crushed tomatoes

steps.text: Prepare chicken by trimming any fat, butterflying or placing between plastic and pounding each breast to an even 1/2-inch thickness; pat dry and season both sides with salt and pepper.

Set up a breading station: place flour in one shallow dish, beaten eggs in a second, and the breadcrumb/Parmesan mixture in a third. Dredge each chicken piece in flour, shake off excess, dip in egg, then press into breadcrumbs to coat evenly.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add olive oil. When oil shimmers, pan-fry breaded cutlets in batches until golden brown on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. Transfer to a paper-towel-lined tray to rest.

While frying, warm the tomato sauce in a saucepan over medium-low heat: add a small splash of oil, sauté minced garlic until fragrant, add tomato sauce, dried oregano, torn basil, and simmer gently, seasoning to taste with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Spread a thin layer of warmed tomato sauce in a baking dish, place fried chicken cutlets in a single layer, spoon sauce over each, sprinkle with remaining Parmesan, then top evenly with shredded mozzarella.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and sauce is bubbling, about 8-10 minutes. For a golden top, finish under the broiler 1-2 minutes while watching closely to prevent burning.
Remove from oven, let rest 2-3 minutes. Garnish with torn basil and chopped parsley; serve with lemon wedges if desired alongside pasta or a green salad.
